headerTagline: I CAN SOLVE RUBIK'S CUBE BLINDFOLDED

skills.popupDetailsText:
My programming journey began in my freshman year of high school, sparked by the Zenit competition. I started with Python, then quickly adopted C++ for its performance in competitive programming, including the Informatics Olympiad (twice succeeded in regionals, both times very close to nationals). This honed my skills in optimization, graph theory, dynamic programming, and more. I also explored LeetCode for additional programming challenges.

In university, I've expanded my toolkit with Java, Go (concurrency), Haskell (functional programming), C (system programming), CL (a Specification and Verification paradigm, a university special), and web technologies (HTML, CSS, JS, PHP). I have applied these skills to solve diverse problems, from competitive algorithms to practical automation scripts in Excel or other tools that make life easier or better.

My GitHub: link:www.github.com/Vl4dk0 showcases some of my work.

My passion for mathematics was ignited in 5th grade with the Math Olympiad. Since then, I've actively competed in major Slovak math contests (Math Olympiad, Klokan, Naboj, and more). Since the 7th grade in primary school, I often studied advanced topics independently, even those covered later at university. To this very day I explore math in my free time. Recently I've been particularly interested in formal proofs and advanced probability.

My experience in competitive programming (Math Olympiad, Informatics Olympiad, KSP, etc.) has provided extensive practice in designing and implementing efficient algorithms and data structures. I'm comfortable with areas like optimization, graph theory, probability, geometry, dynamic programming, and pretty much any other common problem-solving technique. I utilized LeetCode to broaden my exposure to common algorithmic patterns.

My journey through various academic competitions (Math, History, Chemistry, Geography) and the necessity to learn and understand programming languages (Python to C++ for speed in contests, then learning Java, Go, Haskell, etc., at university, Django, CSS, JavaScript, etc., at work) demonstrate my ability to learn new concepts and tools rapidly. I enjoy being challenged and like the feeling of mastering a new skill.

My experience with challenging math and programming seminars, similar to KSP, where I dedicated significant effort (sometimes sacrificing sleep and food) to solve complex problems and ultimately succeeded (a top 10 rank twice in a row), taught me the value of perseverance. It's not just about talent for me; it's about enduring hardships to achieve a goal. This dedication led to my acceptance at Matfyz with a motivational scholarship.

I enjoy identifying opportunities for automation.

For example, I developed TypeScript scripts to automate repetitive data checking and summarization tasks in Excel for my mother, saving her significant time.

Or created tools that helped me save huge amounts of time with my homework. For example, a program that would parse the online editor to a text file and integrating tools that my friends made that brute-forced their way to find closed tableaus in seconds, then automatically re-parsing it back into the online editor format.

This highlights my ability to apply programming skills to solve real-world problems efficiently.

I appreciate almost any type of humor and find it nearly impossible to be offended by a joke. I believe this contributes to a positive and resilient team atmosphere. Importantly, I also understand the importance of context and know when to be lighthearted and when to be serious and focused.

I have studied English in school since the 2nd grade of primary school. I successfully completed my maturity exams (Maturita) with a result in the >85th percentile, achieving a B2 level of proficiency according to the CEFR.

I have studied Russian in school since the 5th grade of primary school. I continued to study it in high school, where I achieved a B1 level of proficiency according to the CEFR. Although I didn't expect it, it turned out to be very handy, as it is easier for me to communicate with my Ukrainian fellow students.

education.popupDetailsText: Throughout my time at Primary School Strážske, I consistently achieved top grades (straight 1s). It was here, particularly from 5th grade onwards, that I discovered my deep interest and aptitude for mathematics, sparked by my participation in the Math Olympiad. This period also marked the beginning of my involvement in competitive volleyball, where our team achieved national success, including a 3rd place finish in the U15 Nationals.

details: In a class focused on Mathematics and Informatics
education.popupTitle: Gymnasium P. Horova - Igniting Programming Passion
education.popupDetailsText: At Gymnasium P. Horova, I continued to excel academically, maintaining top grades while focusing on Mathematics and Informatics. This is where my passion for programming truly ignited, largely thanks to participating in the Zenit competition and to my willing teachers. I realized programming was like 'math, but better,' leading me to dive into Python and later C++. I also continued playing volleyball throughout high school, balancing academics with team sports. This period was instrumental in developing my problem-solving skills through various Olympiads and programming challenges.

details: Faculty of Mathematics, Physics and Informatics
education.popupDetailsText:
At Matfyz (Comenius University), I am in the Applied Informatics program, maintaining a GPA of ~1.04 over two years. The challenging curriculum 'forces' me to continuously learn and solve complex problems. I've gained practical experience in web development (HTML, CSS, JS, PHP), concurrency (Go), functional programming (Haskell), specification-verification (CL), system programming (C), and further honed my problem-solving skills in Python, Java, and C++.

This school has also taught me a great deal about advanced probability and hypothesis testing. It has allowed me to utilize my knowledge in mathematical analysis and linear algebra, and through good mentorship, I've learned how to write formal proofs, an area with which I previously struggled.

aboutMe: Highly motivated and adaptable informatics student with a strong foundation in programming and problem-solving, honed through years of competitive mathematics and informatics.

Seeking a part-time or internship opportunity where I can contribute to innovative projects, further develop my technical skills, and learn from experienced professionals. I am not searching for a specific type of role. I would genuinely enjoy any role involving programming and critical thinking, such as Web Development, Data Science, AI, Game Development, Automation, or applied Mathematics.

experience.popupDetailsText: While this role is different from the positions I am currently seeking, it was my first job and I learned a lot about myself from it. I learned how to communicate with frustrated customers, how to work in a team, and how to plan my time effectively. I also learned about myself that I can finish a job even if I don't particularly enjoy it. I won't collapse under pressure.

experience.popupTitle: SmartBase s.r.o - Junior Django Fullstack developer
experience.popupDetailsText:
At SmartBase s.r.o (June 2024 - April 2025), I worked as a Junior Fullstack Developer on e-commerce projects like link:alo.sk, link:argus.sk, and link:najlekaren.sk. Initially focused on frontend tasks (HTML, CSS, JavaScript from Figma templates), I quickly transitioned to backend responsibilities as well. Key backend tasks included integrating payment APIs and optimizing image loading to reduce users' mobile data consumption.

I greatly valued the learning experience and the team environment. We parted ways amicably as my university commitments required more time than I could dedicate to the role, and for me, studies come first.

subsections.title: My greatest accomplishments in high school:

items.summary: Qualifying for the national round of Math Olympiad
items.popupDetailsText: Qualifying for the national round of the Math Olympiad was a significant personal achievement. It involved months of preparation, tackling complex problems, and it was an honor to compete at that level. This experience greatly sharpened my analytical and problem-solving abilities.

KSP (Korešpondenčný Seminár z Programovania) was a turning point. To qualify, I dedicated immense effort to solving difficult problems, often working through the night. Achieving a top 10 rank twice in a row wasn't just about skill; it was a testament to my ability to endure and persevere. This success directly contributed to my acceptance into Matfyz with a motivational scholarship. I am now a proud member of the KSP team, where I help prepare problems for contests.

This was a key competition that sparked my interest in competitive programming. In my last year of high school, I achieved 2nd place in the regional round of the Zenit competition in programming (Košice region), which also corresponded to a 10th place finish nationwide. This was a great success for me.

Scored in the >96th percentile in the written part of the Maturita (Slovak school-leaving exam) in Mathematics, demonstrating a strong proficiency in the subject.

However, I was not entirely satisfied with my result, as I was aiming for 100% and I missed it by 3 points. This experience taught me the importance of attention to detail.

This competition involved creating three games using Python's Tkinter module. There were over 40 winners, who, for unknown reasons, were not sorted by completion time. The contest was intended to be fun rather than prestigious, but achieving a 100% score was necessary to be recognized as a winner.

This is a pair-programming competition focused on solving four challenging problems within four hours. I participated with my friend, and we achieved 3rd place in the national round, which was a great achievement for us.

Maintaining a 1.05 GPA in my initial semesters reflects my dedication to my studies and my ability to grasp complex concepts in informatics and mathematics quickly. (Note: In Slovakia, 1.0 is the best possible grade).

items.summary: Most points in programming & math subjects (1st year)
items.popupDetailsText: Achieved the most points within my year group during my first two semesters in core programming and mathematical subjects at Comenius University, indicating a strong start and quick grasp of university-level material.

I've actively played volleyball since 5th grade in primary school, competing at a national level. Our team achieved 3rd place in the U15 Nationals one year and 6th the following. This sport has taught me valuable lessons in teamwork, discipline, respect (particularly for our coach), and maintaining an active lifestyle.
